intro: Joosia dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, sandy soils. Joosia dichotoma is adapted to arid environments and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
